comment.realname: Llyfrgell Genedlaethol Cymru  / The National Library of Wales
comment.author: 37199428@N06
comment._content: Knitting items of clothing for the troops was a popular way of supporting the war effort. Newtown Women's Institute held a working party in Community House in the town in November 1939. The main centre of attention though was the Newtown's only male knitter, David Lewis. In this photograph he is seen wearing a 'balaclava' he made for the troops
